content:
=== Game Rules ===
Game rules in natural language:
Below is a plain language breakdown of what the game is about and some ideas for how to tackle it.

• Game Genre and Feel:
 – It’s essentially a retro-style, tile‐based adventure/platform puzzle game in which you navigate a maze-like level. There’s a mix of action, puzzle-solving, and resource management reminiscent of classic arcade or Spelunky-style games.

• Key Game Elements:
 – The Player (Avatar): You control an avatar who can shoot a “sword” (a short‐lived projectile) and must avoid or defeat enemies.  
 – Obstacles and Terrain: The level is made up of walls, dirt blocks, and other stationary tiles that form the maze.  
 – Enemies and Moving Dangers: Random-moving foes (“enemy”), as well as creatures like crabs and butterflies, wander around. In addition, boulders act like falling “missiles” that can hurt you if you’re not careful.  
 – Collectible Resources: Diamonds are scattered throughout the level. They not only add to your score when collected (each diamond gives a bonus) but are also key to the exit condition.
 – Exit Door: There’s an exit door that interacts with your resource count. To “kill” (trigger) the door and finish the level, you must meet a requirement related to diamonds (the rule uses “killIfOtherHasMore resource=diamond limit=9”) – in short, you likely need to have collected at least (or possibly exactly) the right number of diamonds before you can use the door to finish the level.

• How the Mechanics Work:
 – Collisions and Interactions: 
  ○ Touching a diamond as your avatar collects it and increases your score.
  ○ Your sword flickers into existence briefly, and if you hit certain things (like dirt) with it, you kill those sprites.
  ○ Boulders move and “bounce” off walls and other objects. They can harm you unless you manage to use them from above.
  ○ Special interactions occur between enemies: for example, when a butterfly and a crab meet, one may transform into a diamond to reward you.
 – Win/Loss Conditions:
  ○ You lose if your avatar dies (SpriteCounter for avatar drops to 0).  
  ○ You win if you manage to “kill” or clear the exit door sprite (SpriteCounter for exitdoor is 0) – which happens when you have satisfied its requirement (i.e. the proper diamond count).

• Overall Strategy (in plain words):
 1. Plan Your Route: Explore the level carefully. Know where the diamonds are so that you can collect enough to satisfy the exit door’s condition.
 2. Manage Your Resources: Keep an eye on your diamond count. Don’t head for the exit door until you’ve gathered nearly 9 (or the proper number as suggested by the rule) so you can pass through successfully.
 3. Use Your Sword Wisely: Since your sword appears briefly (flickers), use it for critical hits against obstacles (or even using it to clear dirt) and, when needed, to take out enemies.
 4. Be Wary of Dangers: Watch out for roaming enemies and boulders. Use the environment to your advantage – sometimes letting falling boulders hit enemies can be a safe way to dispatch them, but be careful if you’re below a boulder!
 5. Exploit Enemy Interactions: Notice that some enemy interactions (like the butterfly and crab meeting) might yield extra diamonds (with a score bonus). You might intentionally maneuver to trigger these chain reactions.
 6. Timing and Precision: Since the boulders and enemy movements are dynamic, careful timing (especially when moving in tight corridors) is crucial. Avoid getting caught in fatal collisions by moving cautiously, particularly when navigating around boulders and while aiming your sword.

In short, your goal is to explore and collect enough diamond resources, all while dodging hazards and using your sword smartly. Once you’ve met the diamond requirement, head for the exit door to clear the level. Enjoy the old-school challenge and plan your moves carefully!

You are an intelligent player playing a video game, and you have a friend provide you strategy. Interpret the state, rule, strategy and act accordingly. Notice that your avatar position is one of the most important information, if the position doesn't change from the last state, you need to analyze the state and make a different action from the last time.

=== Available Actions ===
0: ACTION_NIL
1: ACTION_USE
2: ACTION_LEFT
3: ACTION_RIGHT
4: ACTION_DOWN
5: ACTION_UP

=== Important Mechanics Notice ===
 In some games, directional actions (LEFT, RIGHT, UP, DOWN) may first cause the avatar to rotate toward the intended direction without immediately moving. If the avatar's position does not change after a directional action, it may indicate a rotation has occurred. To proceed, you must apply the directional action again after rotation. Always verify whether the avatar actually moved after each action. Please understand the rule and the interaction set first, then locate the item, finally choose a meaningful action towards the win and respond in the format: ``` Action:<action number> ```. Include one sentence of feedback on the action and your expectation to see if it aligns with the strategy. Notice, Action 0 will not reasult in any change in this game environment, and you may need to understand the level layout first to play the game. 

=== Sprite Mapping ===
avatar -> 'a'
background dirt -> '.'
background -> '-'
background exitdoor -> 'e'
background boulder -> 'o'
background diamond -> 'x'
background crab -> 'c'
background butterfly -> 'b'
boulder -> '@'
butterfly -> '#'
crab -> '$'
diamond -> '%'
dirt -> '&'
exitdoor -> '*'
wall -> 'b'
boulder butterfly -> 'd'
sword -> 's'

Action:3

I'm moving right from (4,7) into the clear floor at (4,8) to start progressing toward accessible resources and eventually the diamonds needed for the exit.
